meanings.definition: To fill or overcome with terror; terrify.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm was terrorizing the scared puppy.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was terrorizing the audience with its scary scenes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was terrorizing the houseplants by knocking them over.
meanings.sent4: The haunting memories of the past were terrorizing her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the abandoned house was terrorizing to anyone who dared to enter.

meanings.definition: To dominate or coerce by intimidation.
meanings.sent1: The bully was terrorizing the smaller kids on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The dictator was terrorizing the citizens into submission with his oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten was terrorizing the houseplants by knocking them over.
meanings.sent4: The powerful storm was terrorizing the coastal town with its strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The aggressive competitor was terrorizing the market, forcing smaller businesses to shut down.
